_comment: A structured JSON representation of D&D 3.5e rules, organized for clarity and machine readability.

coreMechanic.description: The fundamental process for resolving actions with a chance of failure.
coreMechanic.successCondition: Result equals or exceeds the target number.

standard.description: Roll three 4-sided dice, sum the results, and add 3.

percentile.description: Roll two 10-sided dice. Designate one as the tens digit and the other as the ones digit. A roll of '00' represents 100.

mathRules.rounding: In general, round down, even if the fraction is 0.5 or larger. Exception: Some rolls (e.g., damage, hit points) have a minimum of 1.

abstractValues.description: For modifiers or die rolls. Combine multipliers into a single multiple, with each extra multiple adding 1 less than its value to the first.
abstractValues.example: A x2 and a x2 multiplier result in a x3 multiplier (2 + (2-1) = 3).

realWorldValues.description: For weight or distance. Normal multiplication rules apply.
realWorldValues.example: A creature whose size doubles (weight x8) and is then turned to stone (weight x3) weighs 24 times normal.

types.name: Ability Damage
types.description: Temporary loss of ability score points.
types.recovery: Returns at a rate of 1 point per day per ability (or 2 points with complete bed rest). Can be healed by spells like 'lesser restoration'.

types.name: Ability Drain
types.description: Permanent loss of ability score points.
types.recovery: Only recoverable through magical means, such as the 'restoration' spell.

effectsAtZero.effect: Cannot move. Lies helpless on the ground.
Cannot move. Stands motionless, rigid, and helpless.
Unconscious in a coma-like stupor, helpless.
Withdrawn into a deep sleep filled with nightmares, helpless.
Withdrawn into a catatonic, coma-like stupor, helpless.

abilities.name: Strength
appliesTo: Damage rolls for melee and thrown weapons

abilities.name: Dexterity
appliesTo: Balance, Escape Artist, Hide, Move Silently, Open Lock, Ride, Sleight of Hand, Tumble, and Use Rope checks

abilities.name: Intelligence
appliesTo: Number of bonus languages at start
Appraise, Craft, Decipher Script, Disable Device, Forgery, Knowledge, Search, and Spellcraft checks
Wizard bonus spells and spell DCs

abilities.name: Wisdom

Cleric, Druid, Paladin, and Ranger bonus spells and spell DCs

Turning checks for Clerics and Paladins
Sorcerer and Bard bonus spells and spell DCs

abilityTypes.name: Extraordinary
abilityTypes.description: Nonmagical, but not something anyone can do without extensive training.

abilityTypes.name: Spell-Like
abilityTypes.description: Magical abilities that are very much like spells.

abilityTypes.name: Supernatural
abilityTypes.description: Magical abilities that are not like spells and cannot be dispelled or counterspelled.

commonAbilities.name: Antimagic
commonAbilities.description: An effect that suppresses but does not dispel magic. Spells, spell-like, and supernatural abilities do not function within it. Extraordinary abilities are unaffected. Summoned creatures wink out and reappear when the field ends.

commonAbilities.name: Breath Weapon
commonAbilities.description: A creature expels a substance or energy in a cone or line. It is typically a standard action, requires no attack roll, and allows a saving throw for half damage. Creatures are immune to their own breath weapons.

commonAbilities.name: Damage Reduction
commonAbilities.description: The creature ignores a certain amount of damage from weapons or natural attacks. The damage is negated unless the attack has the quality to bypass it (e.g., magic, adamantine, good). Spells and energy damage ignore DR.

commonAbilities.name: Energy Drain
commonAbilities.description: An attack that bestows one or more negative levels on a target. Each negative level imposes a -1 penalty on most rolls, reduces HP by 5, and reduces effective level by 1. After 24 hours, the victim must make a Fortitude save for each negative level or lose a character level permanently.

commonAbilities.name: Fast Healing
commonAbilities.description: The creature regains a specific number of hit points at the start of its turn. It does not allow regrowth of lost body parts and does not restore hit points from starvation, thirst, or suffocation.

commonAbilities.name: Gaze Attack
commonAbilities.description: An attack that takes effect when an opponent looks at the creature's eyes. Opponents can avert their eyes (50% chance to avoid save, creature gains concealment) or close their eyes (100% chance to avoid save, creature gains total concealment).

commonAbilities.name: Incorporeality
commonAbilities.description: The creature has no physical body. It is immune to all nonmagical attacks and has a 50% chance to ignore damage from any corporeal source, except for force effects or attacks from a 'ghost touch' weapon. Its own attacks ignore natural armor, armor, and shields.

commonAbilities.name: Poison
commonAbilities.description: An attack that delivers a toxin. The victim must make a Fortitude save to resist both initial and secondary damage (usually ability damage). Types include contact, ingested, inhaled, and injury.

commonAbilities.name: Regeneration
commonAbilities.description: Damage dealt to the creature is treated as nonlethal damage, which it heals at a fixed rate. Certain attack forms (typically fire and acid) deal lethal damage that is not regenerated. The creature can regrow or reattach severed body parts.

commonAbilities.name: Spell Resistance
commonAbilities.description: The ability to avoid being affected by spells. To affect the creature, the spellcaster must make a caster level check (1d20 + caster level) equal to or greater than the creature's SR.

conditions.name: Blinded
conditions.effects: -2 AC, lose Dex bonus to AC, half speed, -4 on Search and most Str/Dex checks. Opponents have total concealment (50% miss chance).

conditions.name: Confused
conditions.effects: Acts randomly, determined by a d% roll at the start of the turn.

conditions.name: Dazed
conditions.effects: Unable to take actions, but no penalty to AC. Typically lasts 1 round.

conditions.name: Dying
conditions.effects: At -1 to -9 HP. Unconscious and loses 1 HP per round until stabilized.

conditions.name: Entangled
conditions.effects: Half speed, cannot run or charge, -2 attack rolls, -4 Dexterity. Casting requires a Concentration check.

conditions.name: Exhausted
conditions.effects: Half speed, -6 to Strength and Dexterity. After 1 hour of rest, becomes fatigued.

conditions.name: Fatigued
conditions.effects: Cannot run or charge, -2 to Strength and Dexterity.

conditions.name: Flat-Footed
conditions.effects: Has not yet acted in combat. Loses Dex bonus to AC and cannot make attacks of opportunity.

conditions.name: Grappling
conditions.effects: Engaged in a wrestle. Can take only limited actions. Loses Dex bonus to AC against opponents not in the grapple.

conditions.name: Helpless
conditions.effects: Paralyzed, held, bound, sleeping, or unconscious. Treated as having Dex 0 (-5 modifier). Melee attacks gain a +4 bonus. Can be subject to a coup de grace.

conditions.name: Nauseated
conditions.effects: Unable to attack, cast spells, or concentrate. Can only take a single move action per turn.

conditions.name: Paralyzed
conditions.effects: Frozen in place. Effective Strength and Dexterity are 0. Helpless, but can take purely mental actions.

conditions.name: Prone
conditions.effects: On the ground. -4 on melee attack rolls, +4 AC against ranged attacks, -4 AC against melee attacks.

conditions.name: Shaken
conditions.effects: -2 penalty on attack rolls, saving throws, skill checks, and ability checks.

conditions.name: Stunned
conditions.effects: Drops everything held, can't take actions, -2 penalty to AC, and loses Dex bonus to AC.

conditions.name: Unconscious
conditions.effects: Knocked out and helpless. Occurs from having HP between -1 and -9, or from nonlethal damage exceeding current HP.

progressionTable.special: Bardic music, bardic knowledge, countersong, fascinate, inspire courage +1

psionics.overview: Psionic powers spring from sentient minds and are fueled by a reserve of power points.

powerPoints.source: Gained from class, bonus from high key ability score, race, and feats.

manifesting.concentration: Required to manifest a power. Can be broken by damage or distractions, requiring a Concentration check.

psionicsMagicTransparency.description: Powers and spells interact with each other as if they were the same type of effect.
rules: Spell Resistance works against powers, and Power Resistance works against spells.
Detect Magic detects psionics, and vice versa.
Dispel Magic can dispel powers, and Dispel Psionics can dispel spells.
Dead Magic areas are also Dead Psionics areas.

races.name: Human
specialQualities: 4 extra skill points at 1st level and 1 extra skill point at each additional level.

races.name: Dwarf
specialQualities: Stonecunning: +2 on Search for unusual stonework, can find stone traps.
Stability: +4 bonus to resist bull rush or trip.

races.name: Elf
specialQualities: Proficient with longsword, rapier, longbow, and shortbow.
+2 on Listen, Search, and Spot checks.
